metadata.titel_preek: The Church with a Middle Name: 'West . . . Water and Vegetables . . . Minster'

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church (Daniel) must maintain its acute faith identity by resisting the 'junk food' of the empire (culture) through the discipline of 'water and vegetables' (gospel practices) to become healthy and effective in a complicated world.

tekstueel_bewijs: Daniel resolved to avoid the junk food
a serious church... will have to work at an acute faith identity
this church... able to live its life in trust
produce well-being in the world of raw power
I take the liberty of proposing that Westminster Presbyterian Church... take as its middle name, 'vegetables and water'

ontvanger.identificatie: The World / The Next Generation / The Church itself
tekstueel_bewijs: make a glorious difference in the community
what our children so need to receive from us
sticking to the vegetables and water of the gospel

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily a set of cultural habits and social pressures rather than a cosmic or ontological power.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God acts to provide newness, generosity, and forgiveness.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: God's action is described as the 'reason' the church can act, but the narrative focus remains on the church's choice to 'eat' or 'resist'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Discipline → The Church ← Cultural Junk Food

voorbeelden_god_subject: It is God who enacts newness
God is the one who forgives endlessly
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Daniel resolved to avoid the junk food
We mistakenly imagine that it can be filled
Imagine Westminster Church... set down in a culture

voorbeelden: will have to work at an acute faith identity
take as its middle name 'vegetables and water'
imagine the church... confident and free
the church knows that it is God
They were able to accomplish that precisely because they did not compromise

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the obligation (Devoir) of the church to maintain its identity. Power (Pouvoir) is treated as a result of human discipline rather than a gift of grace.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through human 'resolve' and 'discipline'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is seen as 'junk food'—unhealthy but not necessarily fatal or inescapable without divine intervention.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon mentions God's attributes, the actantial subject is consistently the Church/Daniel. God is the 'reason' or 'motivation' for action, but the Church is the one performing the action of resisting and choosing.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The reason the church acts free... is that the church knows that it is God who makes all things new.
They were able to accomplish that precisely because they did not compromise their faith.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: motivated by gratitude for generosity from God

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Daniel is presented as a model of resolve and discipline for the church to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God preserves His people in exile despite the overwhelming power of the empire.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform; focus on self-discipline and 'resolve'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is a human work fueled by information about God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The 'vegetable' metaphor is consistently applied, but the transition from God's character to human duty is often a 'so' (causal) that places the burden on the human subject.
spanning_punten: God makes all things new vs. The church must work at identity.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The church acts differently because it is motivated by gratitude for generosity from God.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon assumes the hearer has the 'Pouvoir' (power) if they have the 'Savoir' (knowledge).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'junk food'—a bad choice that leads to poor health, rather than a state of death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is structurally anthropocentric. The Church is the hero; God is the landscape or the pantry.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The church is the subject of 'resisting', 'working', and 'maintaining'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God as the one who feeds, preserves, and distinguishes His people.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Daniel resolved', use 'God gave Daniel favor and the strength to stand.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the hungry exile who is fed by God.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the impossibility of resisting the 'empire' without the Spirit.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Gospel *creates* the desire it requires.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Culture/Sin as a 'defilement' that we cannot wash off ourselves.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make grace necessary rather than just helpful.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The metaphor is rhetorically brilliant, but ensure the 'engine' of the sermon is God's faithfulness, not the church's 'resolve'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the 'middle name' is a clever hook; semiotically, it functions as a new Law.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical context of Daniel; semiotics reveals the hearer is being cast as Daniel.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that God is an Adjuvant (Helper) rather than the Subject of the sermon's primary action.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Imagine' imperative, which functions as a call to mental/willful performance.
